title: Investors should shun the star factor
text:
Recent weeks have seen the sad demise of Neil Woodford’s investment management empire. Formerly feted as a brilliant fund manager who enriched hundreds of thousands of savers, many people now regard him as a pariah.

As this sorry tale has been unfolding, there have also been a number of high-profile shenanigans concerning the pay and performance of senior executives in non-financial companies. On the face of it, these things have little in common. But when you look deeper, they share something both pervasive and dangerous, namely excessive belief in the star factor.

Stars exist in almost all fields, including the law, medicine, football, opera – and even journalism. But, by and large, star status...
